p: The NCBI Virus Variation Resource (NCBI-VVR) is a web-based database of a set of viruses, viz. influenza virus, dengue virus, rotavirus, West Nile virus, Ebola virus, Zika virus and MERS coronavirus (Resch et al. 2009). It enables the user to submit their viral sequences along with relevant metadata such as sample collection time, isolation source, geographic location, host, disease severity, etc. It further allows integrating and analysing the viral sequences using the generic tools such as multiple sequence alignment and phylogenetic tree construction.
